start: ^Good morning. We begin today with a developing story out of upstate New York. State Police say they are continuing the search for two women reported missing earlier this week. The pair were last seen driving north toward the Adirondack Mountains late Sunday night.
news_details_1: ^Authorities say the women were traveling along Route 30, a long and isolated stretch of highway. Investigators believe the vehicle may have turned onto Moose River Plains Road after midnight. That area is known for limited lighting, poor cell service, and few passersby.
news_details_2: ^Search crews continue to focus on forest access roads and remote pull-offs. Police say visibility is limited and the terrain makes recovery efforts difficult. No confirmed sightings have been reported since Sunday night.
news_close: ^Authorities are urging anyone who traveled through the area to come forward. The investigation remains ongoing. We’ll bring you more as this develops.
